Subject: Manifesto for Evolving Agents
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=7192225; y=ra_MmR4BSFkTB0B-OYPi5rBABjV7C52UYA0YFpylpNE5cxSgYg
X-Yahoo-Profile: ian_badcoe

Hi all,

	Being a realist, I recognize that I shall probably not finish this 
document any time soon.

	However, it already contains some good stuff that might well 
interest various members of the group.  So I have uploaded the 
work-in-progress version of it to the group's file area.

	All you do is, you unzip it into some folder and then you open 
frame.htm in your favourite browser (actually I only tested it in IE, 
there's some simple javascipt for navigation so it might not work so 
well in other ones but I think it should be OK).  Chapters are 
selected along the top, sections within chapters down the side.

	Note that this is far from finished.  In particular "@@" is my code 
for places where I was going to add more, often only glossary entries 
but sometimes whole paragraphs.  Some sections are completely 
missing.  These are left as an exercise for the reader.

	The references to a MEA discussion group do point to a real mailing 
list, but it has no members because I didn't tell anyone about 
it.  It is more appropriate to have any discussions here.

	What you have in this document, is a detailed analysis of several of 
the mechanisms that make organisms evolvable, along with ideas on how 
to do similar things in software.

	I thought I'd dig this up now, because Ken's recent mails have been 
straying quite strongly into these sorts of areas, and I am hoping 
this is an part of an idea whose time has come.

	Please have a look and post your reactions.

	Ian
